. It contains four villages: China, South China, Weeks Mills, and Branch Mills.

Airports near China, Maine include Waterville Robert Lafleur Airport 6 miles northwest of China, Augusta State Airport 13 miles southwest of China, and Knox County Regional Airport 36 miles southeast of China.

China, ME is home to China Lake, a 54 square mile body of water that boasts excellent fishing.  China Lake features the legendary Indian Heart Rock, a heart that was carved into a boulder on the lake in religious devotion so it would last through the ages.
In addition to China Lake, China features tranquil scenery with rolling hills and beautiful farm land.

China Lake has excellent fishing and hosts several bass tournaments.  Other activities that can be enjoyed onthe lake are swimming, boating and water skiing.  The village of South China has a boat landing where visitors can launch their own boats, rent paddle boats, and swim.

Many children's summer camps are located around China Lake and region.  Also, visitors can enjoy walking, biking, and hiking in the surrounding picturesque area.
Shopping in the China area is limited to small privately owned shops and antique sales.
